title: Question 21
prompt: After work yesterday, Kelly <u>rush to the subway</u> station so that she could make her train.  Unfortunately, she was three minutes late, and the train departed without her.
description: Read the following sentences and look at the underlined parts.  Choose the answer that is written correctly for each underlined part.
feedback: The sentence is describing something that happened yesterday, so it takes place in the past. The verb should be in the past tense. The correct past tense of the verb 'to rush' is 'rushed.' The past tense usually has an -ed ending, indicating that the event took place in the past. The other answer choices are not in the correct tense for this sentence.
